summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from September 2019 forwarding information about a media interview. The content reveals that an unnamed woman (likely a victim or associate) gave an interview to Savannah Guthrie/NBC, in which she claims to have been interviewed by the FBI in 2011, named girls she helped traffic, stated other women told the DOJ Epstein trafficked them to other men, and alleged hidden cameras in Epstein's properties.

persons.name: Savannah Guthrie
persons.context: Conducted an interview with an unnamed woman who made allegations about Jeffrey Epstein's trafficking and surveillance.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the central figure who trafficked women to other men and had cameras installed in his properties for surveillance.

connections.description: The unnamed woman interviewed alleges she was involved in Epstein's trafficking operation and provided names of girls she helped traffic.

events.title: FBI Interview of Unnamed Woman
events.description: An unnamed woman claims she was interviewed by the FBI in 2011, during which she gave the names of all the girls she helped traffic for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Media Interview with Savannah Guthrie
events.description: An unnamed woman gave an interview to Savannah Guthrie, revealing details about Epstein's trafficking, her prior FBI interview, and hidden cameras in Epstein's properties.

events.title: SDNY Interview of Unnamed Woman
events.description: The unnamed woman also states she was interviewed by the Southern District of New York (SDNY), though no specific timeframe is given.

locations: NYC house (Epstein's New York City property)
keyFacts: An unnamed woman claimed in a 2019 media interview that she was interviewed by the FBI in 2011 and provided names of girls she helped traffic for Jeffrey Epstein.
The same woman alleged that two other women told the Department of Justice that Epstein specifically trafficked them to 'other men'.
The woman stated there were hidden cameras in Epstein's New York City house and other properties, allowing him to watch people in bathrooms and elsewhere.
The interview was scheduled to air on NBC's 'Today' show and an episode of 'Dateline' on the upcoming Friday.
The document is an internal FBI email forwarding this media-related intelligence, indicating law enforcement monitoring of public allegations.
